Package org.cesecore.util

Class LookAheadObjectInputStreamTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.util.LookAheadObjectInputStreamTest
  • public class LookAheadObjectInputStreamTest
extends Object
    Tests LookAheadObjectInputStream class that can be used to prevent java deserialization issue
    Version:
    $Id: LookAheadObjectInputStreamTest.java 34262 2020-01-13 12:27:31Z jeklund $

      Test deserializing interface implementations where implementation is not belonging to the correct package

      Test that array of mixed (accepted and non-accepted) objects can NOT be deserialized

      Test that non-accepted java objects can NOT be deserialized (SecurityException has to be thrown)

      Test that array of non-accepted java objects can NOT be deserialized (SecurityException has to be thrown).
      void testDeserializingPrimitiveTypes()
      Test that Primitive types (boolean, char, int,...), their wrappers (Boolean, Character, Integer,...) and String class can always be deserialized
      void testDeserializingWithNonWhitelistedField()
      Test deserializing class where field object is not whitelisted
      void testLimitingMaxObjects()
      Test limiting maximum count of objects that can be deserialized
      void testNonInitializedLookAheadObjectInputStream()
      Test that non-initialized LookAheadObjectInputStream can not read any objects (except default (primitive) ones)

      • testDeserializingNonAcceptedJavaObjectArray

        public void testDeserializingNonAcceptedJavaObjectArray()
                                                 throws Exception
        Test that array of non-accepted java objects can NOT be deserialized (SecurityException has to be thrown). Although deserialization of non-accepted class is not exploit by itself, it seems natural to not allow it.
        Throws:
        Exception - fail
